website_summaries.verdict: Master & Dynamic's MH40 headphones are luxuriously crafted, sound terrific, and are well worth the high price.
pros: Plenty of accessories, including a desktop stand

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous product
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones as they scream of quality. Clear to see the company take great pride in their product from packaging, messaging and of course the product itself. Lovely materials and sound quality is great. Only suggestion would be too make earcups a small bit bigger but perhaps i just have big ears...
customer_reviews.author: JoSoap

customer_reviews.title: On the right track, far to travel.
customer_reviews.text: In short, no. Look elswhere, the design team focused purely on engineering aesthetics at the cost of comfort. The equivalent of Alfa Romeo. Shame.
customer_reviews.author: the realist

customer_reviews.title: Good overall quality
customer_reviews.text: Good overall quality, well crafted and built. Sturdy. May not be totally suitable for on the move... I do not use these out and about, just at home. Cable is a bit short for my liking, would have preferred a slightly longer cable.
customer_reviews.author: B. Singh

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best headphones you can buy
customer_reviews.text: Like many I approached these with the view that they were very expensive and just "style cans" with no substance. How wrong I was... These are stunningly packaged. Realyl stunning to look at, built like nothing else and sound AWESOME. So good my Fidelio X1's, Sennheiser Momentum's, B&W P5's & P7's have all been sold. They really are that good🎧🎧😎
customer_reviews.author: Peter Odukwe

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This headphones are just amazing. The sound just grabs you. They scream quality. Buy these. They are with Every penny
customer_reviews.author: Kapadia

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Stunning! Was a little hesitant as not noise cancelling but the sound quality is such that this doesn't matter. They look beautiful and are worth the money. I bought them as a gift and they were very well received.
customer_reviews.author: Sara England

customer_reviews.title: Luxurious. Unique.
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Sharp looking. However, some have remarked that they look like "steampunk" headphones; not really the luxurious description you'd expect. As for the the sound, it's very flat and neutral. Good mid and treble, unoffensive bass. Leaks a lot of sound even at low volume. Comfort: Very good, can sit on your ears for a while without it being too constricting. However, they are heavy, and can fall off easily with some normal head movement. In conclusion, I would recommend if you're looking for a great sounding, well built, and unique pair of headphones. However, for the money, I would look elsewhere: Go wireless, check out Bose or B&O.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice WHILE they worked....but worthless now
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this pair in 2016. They were nice while they lasted! LH speaker died last week. Fast response from M&D but sadly no fix. So at $406 purchase price for 3 years worth of service with no way to repair, certainly not worth the investment. M&D did offer a small discount on another pair which was nice but I will look elsewhere to replace. There are dozens of high-end head sets around with better warranty and a way to fix if they fail.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful sound; constantly breaking cords
customer_reviews.text: I received these headphones as a gift and I like them so much I even replaced the headphones themselves when I lost them. Nevertheless (as a non-sound expert), I have to say I'm shocked how often the actual cord that comes to connect with phone loses connection. I feel like every month these headphones need new (and expensive) cords. And new cords fixes the problem so it doesn't feel like my phone. Keep it in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen Whelan

customer_reviews.title: Stunning headphones
customer_reviews.text: It's all been said, but I figured I'd throw another review out there reiterating the obvious: These are beautiful headphones, the sound is great, with punchy bass blending into a reasonably neutral sound, and the craftsmanship... holy crap. These are all metal and leather. They're the highest quality headphones I've ever held from a build standpoint. I have Sennheiser HD650s, Audio Technica m50x's, beyer dt770s, and numerous other headphones. You could say I'm a hobbyist. The build quality of these blows all of my other cans out of the water. I prefer the sound to my other closed back headphones for most listening(although the beyers and ATH are fantastic too). Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: calebandRR

customer_reviews.title: What you need to know but no one will tell you (or at least could tell us)
customer_reviews.text: These are high ohm headphones which means they will not reproduce sound properly from items such as laptop, ipod or cell phone without an amplifier. While the amplifier isn't overly expensive it is something folks should be aware is needed. When we contacted Amazon and Master and Dynamics and advised of our issues they didn't advise that buying the amplifier would sold the problem and we had to return multiple headphones as we thought they weren't functioning.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C

customer_reviews.title: Quality Finally
customer_reviews.text: This is the third pair of these headphones I've purchased, I broke my first pair, my second pair were regifted to my college boy but only to make room without guilt for my third pair of these bad boys. I'm really only interested in over all sound quality, I'm happily sticking with these again. I gone through at least 20 different pair, from Grado to Bowers & Wilkins to AKG, and on and on till these Master Dynamic found themselves comfortably wrapped around my head and mind. Thank you gentlemen, D Strait
customer_reviews.author: D. Strait

customer_reviews.title: Bad sound quality, even worse noise bleed
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on the great reviews and was so excited to get them. Can I just say, one of the biggest let downs I've experienced. The sound quality is weak at best, but the biggest issue is the noise bleed. Even adjusted to fit snug over my ears with no discernable gaps, sound poured from these headphones. There's no way I could wear these at work, which is a disappointment, because material-wise, they're stunning. You can tell a lot of effort went into design; but you don't buy headphones to look at them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Finch

customer_reviews.title: Built to last
customer_reviews.text: Built feels great and durable with the intention to last over the years. Attention to details and ergonomics were also considered with it being able to sit nicely on the neck without choking you. Sound quality feels warm and with a solid bass. High notes feel crisp and mid tones are on an average. The only 2 downside to the headphone is it's weight which will affect certain users that are not used to heavy headgear. The headphone also grips less on the high and will drop if you bend your head down too suddenly so no hardcore head banging. Overall a stylish and awesome headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Leonard Lam

customer_reviews.title: These Cans Don't Leak Sound
customer_reviews.text: I was blasting electronic music pretty loudly from these in the quiet section of the library recently. Curious as to whether I was causing a disturbance, I put my phone a few feet away from me and set it to record. When I listened to the recording, I could clearly hear people shuffling feet, typing on keyboards, coughing, from across the room. But could barely make out the song I was listening to. So yeah, suffice it to say these are quiet enough for use in public... as long as you keep them on your head! Like most big headphones, once you take them off the sound is no longer sealed and they basically become loudspeakers :P
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound and supreme build quality
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are incredible. I'll leave the build since everyone has covered them. Let's talk about sound. WOW. I've never heard something quite like this. These are miles ahead Bose, Sony, or Beats. The bass response is extremely detailed, punchy yet never over emphasized. The tones are warm but extremely appealing. Scintillating mids and highs. The highs are really where these cans shine. The soundstage is very wide which is something which took me by surprise considering these are closed back. These cans carry a lot of the sound found in open back. Overall, these are absolutely amazing and I'd buy them again with my eyes closed.
customer_reviews.author: Niladri Shekhar Dutt

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: Love these headphones! I got these about 7 months ago and couldn't be happier. Note: These headphones are not exactly high bass or really focus on any one sound in particular. The sound is neutral, but very rich. Get ready to hear things you've never really picked out before, but don't expect these to reverberate down your spine or anything. 5/5 from me, these things just feel like pure amazing luxury.
customer_reviews.author: Zach D.

customer_reviews.title: nice, but not all 100% in satisfaction.
customer_reviews.text: it was considering as one of top ranks and brand of the headphone in the market, but it seemed not completely to overcome some ideas on its design and features with the engineering concepts. Many of its features, such as the active noise cancelling and volume, were all designed in such small buttons, made it so difficult to control or operate, not to mention about its carrying pouch, the company has already done and been manufacturing their products with so many productions, which means they could easily come up with something or use something more solid and durable as a protective carrying case to prevent any drop or fall by accident.
customer_reviews.author: TYLER WUCHUNTA

customer_reviews.title: Incredible build quality and attention to every detail. Hand made too!
customer_reviews.text: Nearly a work of art and much better in your hand than in pictures. Incredible build quality and beautiful materials and packaging. The sound has great solid bass but not in a way like Beats. More defined and solid, not muddy. Mids and highs are clear and tight too. Awesome value for the price. Cant beat these unless you spend much more. I wasn't aware that the mike and remote cable was for Apple products only but i dont mind.
customer_reviews.author: spore

customer_reviews.title: Total Trash.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these off the amazon truck at what i thought was a good price. unbeknownst to me, these things are total trash. one channel doesnt really work on the pair I have. if you fiddle around with the cord enough, you get sound in both sides, but im not totally convinced it's actually stereo. I contacted amazon for a return and they refused to deal with it. they told me to contact the manufacturer. What a pain in the ass those people are. needes to say i just have a very expensive paperweight. Master & Dynamic sucks. Good reason why you haven't heard of them until you read this review. junk city
customer_reviews.author: Lucifer Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Solid Value With Beautiful Headphones
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a great headphone. Pros: Construction/design Balanced sound in low mid and high frequencies. Packaging Cons: Weight is heavy Overall, a good quality headphone at an affordable price. Though heavy Diego solid metal construction, the ear pads are cushioned with lambskin creating comfort. Music, all types, sounds very good. I would highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: brian miller

customer_reviews.title: Overly compressed mid to upper range with lack of details, boomy low-end
customer_reviews.text: I've worked in the pro-audio industry for 17 years. Bottom line is that I should have stuck with my V-Moda M100 headphones for casual listening. After fixing the brackets on my M100, I went back and forth between the MH40 and the M100 dozens of times with different types of music and there is just no comparison. Most notably, female vocals are distant and lost in the boomy low end. Very compressed mid to upper registers. Lifeless in comparison to the M100. The difference is similar (but not quite as bad) as being in the room with a live band, vs standing in the nearby hallway. Good headphones until you hear the M100. Otherwise, unsatisfying.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas H

customer_reviews.title: I Love These Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of MH40’s. I still have my first & second pair, but the headband was starting to diminishing the first, as I was wearing them 3+ hours per day. The sound quality is excellent, especially for my preference of guitar heavy rock music. I listen to a lot of vinyl records, and also make digital copies of my records. I find the MH40’s give me a great interpretation of the true sound of these records.
customer_reviews.author: christopher m.

customer_reviews.title: For the price, OUTSTANDING!
customer_reviews.text: I was not sure what to expect as I had never heard of Master & Dynamic before. I have generally always had the Sony MDR-V6, and liked them quite a lot, so when it came time to replace those, I did a lot of looking. These look amazing and the sound is really great. Light powerful base and clean highs and mids with very little noise even at high volume levels. The extra cord with the volume control is terrible, but I had no interest in that from the start, but on the whole, these are excellent cans!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor A. Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Nice, detailed sound, but very bass-heavy.
customer_reviews.text: I like them a lot. Design-wise they are really nice and feel like a durable product. Sound-wise, they are very detailed but they are very bassy. Too much bass IMHO if you want to use them indoors or not loud environments. However I've found them to be very good for noisy spaces. For example, they sound quite nice while traveling by bus. The extra bass makes them keep a good sound when your surroundings are loud. So ,I'd recommend them if you're gonna use them in loud environments. If it's gonna be in quiet spaces, I think bass is a bit too much.
customer_reviews.author: ralph__86

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, build quality but for a larger head
customer_reviews.text: 1. They sound great! 2. They feel great! 3. They are beautiful and comes with beautiful packaging. 4. The are kind of heavy on the head 5. They do not sit well on smaller heads 6. I have a 22in/58 cm head they are a little loose on my head and I can’t tighten them down
customer_reviews.author: S. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: All style, no substance
customer_reviews.text: I never write one star reviews. But this calls for it. Nice solid construction and stylish design, but totally unlistenable sound quality. My blutooth-enabled hearing aids sound ten times better, not to mention the Bose headphones. I sent them back the next day.
customer_reviews.author: jbrew2001

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is better than any bose or plantronics out there. I only wish they extended slightly more because they are a little small on my big head. Also they don't work with Xbox unfortunately. They do work well for phone calls and are amazing for music though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfy with superior sound
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have always been favorites of mine. They’re a tad heavier, so they don’t go out with me, but they live on my head all day at work. Rich, warm natural sound, and decent isolation due to the closed back design. I don’t find them too heavy during normal use but some might if they use them as walking-around headphones. Two cables in a nice little box and the canvas bag make these feel premium (and they are). The ear pads are super comfortable. I recommend these to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: John Bell

customer_reviews.title: Sound is good, but just not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have an average-sized head, and these headphones just weren't comfortable. After only 5 minutes of listening I had a hotspot on the top of my head, and the too-small earcups were crushing my earlobes. Additionally, there is some sibilance in the sound that makes listening fatiguing as well. If you are fine with uncomfortable headphones, or you have a very small and wide head, maybe these can be for you. Otherwise, look elsewhere. For less than $100 more I recommend the Sony Z7 used.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Husband Loves These!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband. We've never bought an expensive pair of headphones and I was leery. But I have to say, they are of extremely good and durable quality and very versatile. He loves them. He especially likes that he can unplug the headset from the wire and take them back and forth between his drums and computer.
customer_reviews.author: tnrickman

customer_reviews.title: wrong colors shipped - but still attractive headphones
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the navy/silver MH40 but got gunmetal black, so be careful. However, they are still attractive. The sound did not work at all until I fussed with the cables several times; now they are fine (tho not as fine as Sennheiser 650s). A bit uncomfortable on my left ear but expect that to improve with use. I enjoy the fact that the cable is longer than my crummy Bose cable, and that I can choose either left or right side for it.
customer_reviews.author: J.J.

customer_reviews.title: Great for all music types
customer_reviews.text: Tried these on a suggestion from a friend. Sound quality is a very subjective thing but, to my ear, the MH40 are much more neutral compared to beats and have more air and realism compared to Bose. The build quality is outstanding and I find these to be very comfortable even though they are on the heavier side for over ear monitors. These work good while being driven right from my iPhone and while no external amp is needed, I also drive these with a Fiio E17k amp with great results.
customer_reviews.author: Andy P.

customer_reviews.title: Better than Bose
customer_reviews.text: Great sounding and well constructed this headphone is much better than my inner ear noise reduction Bose headphones with the Bose I had to turn up the volume to hear on my iPad but with the master & dynamics I had to turn down the volume and the sound quality is much better. These I think will last many years with the high quality and details in the making of this headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones, wish they stayed on my head better
customer_reviews.text: These are really cool solid headphones. The only problem I have with them is that they don't stay on my head as well as my beats did. I had beats for about 2and a half years before they broke and 2 years in, they stopped working wirelessly. I bought these because I was sick of cheap plastic manufacturing and I wanted over ear headphones, not on-ear. They sound nice, look cool, and are made well. I only have a problem with the grip. If I move my head down quickly, they slip off.
customer_reviews.author: Sahar

customer_reviews.title: Mine quit after a few weeks use but...
customer_reviews.text: These things are aesthetically pleasing in that they look and feel - heck, they reek of high quality. Sound was excellent! Mine were a 70th birthday present and I absolutely loved them. Unfortunately they only lasted a few weeks. Just quit working one night. Liked them so much I took a chance, returned them and asked for a replacement which is in process as I write this.
customer_reviews.author: growingoldoffensively

customer_reviews.title: best sound with some quirks
customer_reviews.text: These are the best sounding headphones I have ever listened to. The controls on the power cord seems to be apple only. No problem, I can do that on my phone or mixer. As others have said, the headphones will not stay on your head on their own. if you are going to move your head you will need to hang on to them. They are designed for listening, that it does well.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Miller

customer_reviews.title: Natural mood booster!
customer_reviews.text: This may be the best set of headphones I've owned. I don't say this because I hear more depth and range through them (although that's true). I say this because while I'm wearing them I constantly find myself smiling and wanting to dance.
customer_reviews.author: Oxford Wellingsbourgh

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought them earlier
customer_reviews.text: Extremely comfortable and good isolation. High fidelity. I am not an expert on the subject, but I hear very detailed sound from them and judge the quality as a musician. Although they are heavy when held on hands, that is not an issue when one wears them.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Souza

customer_reviews.title: Build Quality is unrivaled.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second MH40 pair I have had experience with. There is debate over the subjective quality of the sound, but there is little in this price range with this mix of sound quality and build quality. Even in the ~$2000 price range of HD850's and such, the build quality is at best equal, in many cases lower to what these cans provide. Worth noting that I use them at a desk and only take them on shorter domestic flights due to the weight and space allocation of taking them.
customer_reviews.author: Human Person

customer_reviews.title: Great aesthetic in white!
customer_reviews.text: A little heavy, stays on head ok. Great sound quality! Good for cell phone conversations which is very useful when I call doctors from my cubicle.
customer_reviews.author: Twenty McGill

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Very good sound. Fitment could be better as they are a bit small.
customer_reviews.text: I like the looks and style. I think they sound very good...not the best I've heard but definitely worth the $169 that I paid. Packaging is very well done. I'd buy them again and buy them for a gift. Wish they were adjustable for a larger head. I max out the headband and need to stay still to keep them from sliding up.
customer_reviews.author: Warren Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality-no big “beats” advertisement
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of M & D’s. Bought th army green ones as I like the color but was wanting a pair for work/travel only. The other ones I use for the gym. When you sweat the leather will wear.
customer_reviews.author: FearYah

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: It has a solid feel, metal, not plastic. It covers my whole ear and the leather is very soft. Good sound. But I didn't compare to other high end products.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: My Best Purchase of the year.
customer_reviews.text: I stressed on buying these but turned into my best purchase of the year. They sound great, very comfortable. I use these for flights or when I just want to get away from the world. My ears never get too hot when wearing these and since they are noise isolating they require no battery's. .The craftsmanship is excellent. I chose these over the Bose noise cancelling earphones, I made the right decision.
customer_reviews.author: lookingatwalls

customer_reviews.title: LOOKS COULD KILL!
customer_reviews.text: WELL IF LOOKS COULD KILL THESE WOULD BE AT THE TOP OF THE HEAP, BUT THEY ARE NOT WORTH WHAT THEY COST. THE AUDIO QUALITY IS PISS POO. THEY HAD NO VOLUME AT ALL THE JAKS WERE VERY LOOSE IN THE SOCKETS AND ONLY WENT RIGHT OR LEFT EAR IF THEY WERE JIGGLED. IDON'T RECOMEND.
customer_reviews.author: Bard

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, bad cable
customer_reviews.text: These are simply one of the best headphones I've had. However, GET YOURSELF AN AUDIOPHILE CABLE. The one provided is of poor quality. After several weeks of use, the headphone cable starts to drop sound out of one earphone.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Wie

customer_reviews.title: Sketchy build/lousy build !!! No
customer_reviews.text: One of cushions simply detached from the structure right before I started to use it. It’s unacceptable sketchy build for what I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Margiela Martin

customer_reviews.title: Look for different brand in this price range .
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed that just after couple days I have to change my review, when I received headphones I was super exited about build quality and sound , but just after 5 days left side stop working. These headphones should last more than 5 days for their price!
customer_reviews.author: igor

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones, have a bit of weight to them, but that's only negative I can say. Sound is excellent, pads are very comfortable even after wearing for long periods. I'd highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, great design, ear-pads should be slightly bigger to fit bigger ears
customer_reviews.text: Great “musical” sound even out of the box. Great design. Burn-in even improves sound.
customer_reviews.author: Ganie

customer_reviews.title: Nice headphones
customer_reviews.text: If you love your music and have to hear every sound, then these are your phones.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Nicola

customer_reviews.title: So far, best sound experience
customer_reviews.text: Love these, I only wish I could turn into volume up and down on my Samsung. Just got them today! Will update after 2 weeks of use!
customer_reviews.author: FullofJoy

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these! He has had them over 6.months and uses them daily. Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THEM!!!
customer_reviews.text: I Absolutely love these headphones, they are all around perfect for anything you would want. The sound quality is amazing, they are a little heavy but honestly... They are made to last decades, no srsly it even says so on the box lol.You cant go wrong with these!
customer_reviews.author: thomas m

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Great sound quality as well the overall quality of the headphones are amazing. They look beautiful in the pictures but even better in person.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Anaya

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely no customer service
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are very nice to look at. The sound quality is nice but the main problem I have with this brand is the customer service or lack of. I have sent them 3 emails the last 2 weeks and no reply. Just imagine if you need to get ahold of them about warranty if your set stops working. I will NEVER purchase another Master & Dynamic headphone again. You’re better off spending your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Emerson

customer_reviews.title: MH50+ headphones have great sound and Build
customer_reviews.text: Great build quality, Great sound quality, weak magnets on ear pads so pads came off frequently. I would recommend this set of headphones to anyone looking for great sound and build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Cohen

customer_reviews.title: Love everything about them!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very detailed sound, bass is a little higher than expected but it doesn’t drown out the mods or highs. Love the quality and comfort of these cans?
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Does not include headphone stand like shown above!
customer_reviews.text: The headphones sound pretty good. The miss and highs have really good definition but the lows are completely lacking. I’m still satisfied with the sound quality; however, they DO NOT come with the headphone stand like shown in the picture. I thought that addition would be standard with the limited edition.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Bedell

customer_reviews.title: You’re buying these for the way they look...
customer_reviews.text: These are quality headphones. The comfort is great and I’m a 71/2 so if your dome is bigger- first of all ya got a real big head but also the might not fit. The sound is super clean, but if you want lots of bass not the best option. Overall, very happy. Oh read the manual- I was using the wrong cord for a week and thought I had been robbed.
customer_reviews.author: davisevan11

customer_reviews.title: Much Better Than Other More Expensive Headphones.
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. They are not the greatest, but they are much much better than other more expensive ones. They have good amount of base and are aesthetically amazing.
customer_reviews.author: LA Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Comfort and compatibility
customer_reviews.text: Headphones are quite heavy on my head. I’m always having to adjust for comfort as it tends to slide backwards. Awkward! I cannot use them with the new iPhone as the jack has changed. The sound is clear but the noise cancelation is ok...I have to raise the volume in order to shut down the clamor of the city streets. The headband is less fragile then the Beats which cracked and are now useless. The look is very sophisticated and stylish. Suggestion- connector which can be used with new IPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones for me - under $1500.00
customer_reviews.text: I have tried electrostats, planars, and dynamic. These MH 40's are the best sounding headphones for me, under $1500.00. I use them for music, games but not movies. Late night use only. What's at $1500.00+ you may ask? :) Read my other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Div Nanjappa

customer_reviews.title: SUPER SOUND QUALITY, BEAUTIFULLY DESIGNED HEADPHONES
customer_reviews.text: LOVE the sound quality of these headphones; I've never heard better sound! Nice construction and fit well with the adjustments one can make themselves! My only wish is that they were wireless to use in all situations such as while walking and excercising.
customer_reviews.author: Hummingbird Girl

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: These are simply amazing. They have great clarity without sacrificing bass. They sound better than the Focal listen pros I have. Definitely worth the price. They are slightly heavy but I knew that going in and don't mind it. They may not have active noise cancelling but the passive noise cancelling works great without me having to crankup the volume.
customer_reviews.author: Tech

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm not satisfied for the cost. The inline cord, volume up and down buttons do not work at all on computer or phone, what's the point? There is no noise cancellation, actually very opposite. I can hear everything around me and you can very well hear everything im listening to. I thought I'd give it some time to like them but I just don't. They look sleek, sound is good besides hearing everything in my environment. Hence, my rating.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey V.

customer_reviews.title: Picking up intermittent faint radio transmissions
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product just a few days ago for use while transcribing digitally recorded legal proceedings, because I was weary of constantly replacing cheaper earbuds and headsets. The sound quality is fine, but in the silence of the early morning during a lull in the digital recording playback, I realize I seem to be picking up some sort of extremely faint radio signal through the headset. Is that even possible, or am I becoming Joan of Arc and hearing voices?
customer_reviews.author: David Zinn

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 6 days
customer_reviews.text: Everything with these headphones were great, one of the better pairs I have owned, for 6 days... They stopped producing any sound after less than a week, if I knew they could stop working so quickly, I would have gotten a different brand entirely, I was only using the pair for an hour or two a day, and it completely shut off on me, I'm really disappointed I spent $150 on these. I hope this is just an issue with my pair and not the brand in general.
customer_reviews.author: omEon

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I just got them yesterday so I'm definitely in the honeymoon stage. That being said, I love these headphones. The earcups are soft and make an easy seal. I agree they are definitely heavy compared to Sennheiser-Momentum's or something along those lines but they are just so quality that I don't care. I've listened to them for a few hours straight with a variety of genres and I have to say they are just seriously fun and have a warmth to them that I really enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: richard irwin

customer_reviews.title: Craftsmanship is ridiculous!
customer_reviews.text: These are my fourth pair of headphones in 6 months and they're incredible! Sound, comfort, and build quality are everything you've read. The stand is also a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond DeMento

customer_reviews.title: When grouping for sale.  Wireless=wireless. Not with this
customer_reviews.text: No controls I could find. So. not applicable. But wasn't wireless like the others that was in the group being compared
customer_reviews.author: cruzade

customer_reviews.title: You need these if you strive for great sound at a more than reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I got these headphones for Black Friday and they are incredible. Sound is so clear and balanced perfectly. Not to much treble, not to much base. I've owned a lot of fairly expensive headphones ($200-$300) and this is such a step up. Even though $400 isn't cheap, for what you are getting it is worth it. Most people don't even know what good headphones sound like, but if you are someone that wants to, buy them while they're on sale ($248!!!).
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Returned - audio didn't work properly
customer_reviews.text: They looked nice but the cables weren't connecting right or maybe it was the audio port. Tried both cables and the sound wasn't coming through both sides properly, turning them around in the port would help slightly but even when sound was coming in both sides the vocals sounded muffled for some reason. Got refunded quickly, might be a rare mishap but I didn't feel like risking it and getting another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna J. Lukich

customer_reviews.title: Lacking beautiful leather
customer_reviews.text: Not as nice as their others with leather instead of silver medal
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Willie

customer_reviews.title: Get these!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve gone through many types of headphones, Jabra elites, Bose, Bose SoundSport, Sennheiser momentum’s, AirPods...The build quality is amazing! Fit is snug. The SOUND!!! Just get these!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rheana A. Foster

customer_reviews.title: My fussy husband loves them!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband for his birthday and he LOVES THEM. He researched which headphones to buy for so long, and is very fussy about sound quality! He finally decided these were the ones, and he is over the moon. Of course they are very pricey, but he thinks they are definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding headphones
customer_reviews.text: Best headphones I have ever had materials and sound are outstanding and the price was hard to believe
customer_reviews.author: D. Guevara

customer_reviews.title: I love them but.... DO NOT BUY STAND BY M&D
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headphones. sounds quality is the best you are going to get for this price. They also look great...but.... because of the crazy amount of weight YOU WILL become uncomfortable on the crown of your head. ALSO. DO NOT GET THE STAND not only is the stand astoundingly pricey but the weight of the headphones hanging on the stand Will push into the padding of the headphones which in the end we'll be less comfortable I will wear the padding out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I love the quality and how clear these headphones are. There are some things I'd change about them but overall they are one of the best I've had.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.!
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones, not only because the look amazing, but they sound just as awesome.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable headphones for long music sessions
customer_reviews.text: when using these for long sessions, sound is crisp and good on mid to low tones. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Preformance Until Static Shock
customer_reviews.text: These were outstanding headphones! I used them every day at work for about 9 months. The dry weather caused a bad static shock when I fist bumped my coworker, and it caused me to get shocked in the left ear. Since then, there is a constant static popping in that annoys the hell out of me. I'd 100% recommend these headphones if you don't live in a dry part of the country.
customer_reviews.author: Grant E.

customer_reviews.title: I love these!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE these headphones. They sound fantastic and are so well made! I get compliments on them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and noise isolation!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on the plane. Watch out for the static though if you have any metal ear piercings.
customer_reviews.author: Beccreative

customer_reviews.title: Not an audiophile but...
customer_reviews.text: I checked out geeky audio websites that rated these headphones well and, let's be honest, they're way more stylish than Beats or Bose!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Hello TechHeads
customer_reviews.text: Great set of head phones. Relatively light weight, beautiful classic design. I use these to plug into my guitar amp. The price is not for the faint of heart, but, if you can spare the dough they're definitely worth it. I will probably buy the blue pair. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: jorge

customer_reviews.title: Sound is very good now craftsmen ship is WOW
customer_reviews.text: Sound is very good now craftsmen ship is WOW!!!! So beautiful and smooth defiantly a woman Poom Poom getter so retro and just wow in the looks department this is aggression in its most elegant form !!!
customer_reviews.author: Hector R.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon’s reduced price!
customer_reviews.text: Very good sound, not quite as good as the Grado 325’s.
customer_reviews.author: Grasshopper

customer_reviews.title: High-end features with a mid-range price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing sound quality. At a great price. I use these on my electronic drums for practice and as a monitor for recording. Booming Bass, Rock solid mid-range, the highs are crystal clear without being to tinny. I can wear these things for hours without discomfort.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond B.

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: They’re pretty loose even for my big head. You can’t really move around too much while you’re wearing them or they’ll fall off. Also a little lacking in the mids. They look nice though.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Right speaker stopped working within the first day of use.
customer_reviews.text: I received the device and it sounded great however the right ear cuts out completely sometimes. I've only had the item for one day. When the sound cuts it make a static sound which sounds like it may be a wiring issue. The only way to get any sound back is to delicately re-adjust the earpiece until it comes back. Extremely disappointed with the amount of money spent on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Wanky_Wild

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but
customer_reviews.text: I’m gonna return and will pay extras to get the wireless M60 because this one MH40 cord keep getting in my knees when i sit down and stand up
customer_reviews.author: Lam Tran

customer_reviews.title: SOUND IS AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Thank you so much for an awesome Head Phone! Love is the sound
customer_reviews.author: Moira

customer_reviews.title: The cushion of head bar is too hard.
customer_reviews.text: I can not satisfy the head cushion and earpad size but, it's a pretty nice design and sound quality though. There's a pain in the pressure that's weighing down on the head. If you use this headphone to work or listen to music for a long time, I don't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Headphones
customer_reviews.text: The one drawback is that the headphones are somewhat heavy and will slip off your head if you lean forward.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones for discounted price
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up on treasure truck sale. No active noise cancellation but pads are reasonably isolating. Sound quality is pretty good running on a desktop DAC.
customer_reviews.author: David M

customer_reviews.title: Petite person!
customer_reviews.text: I am petite and have a small head. I wear glasses. These are wired They have an earphone jack in each ear cup so you can share what you're listening to with someone else. Very comfortable Gorgeous Not an audiophile by any means but sound quality for me is A-ok.
customer_reviews.author: Beezer The Cat

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 10 months
customer_reviews.text: It stop working after 10 months of normal use. Try to contact their customer support but didn’t get a response. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Well built premium headphones
customer_reviews.text: Very well built, great sound, fantastic bass. (A little heavier than other headphones), but I love em'
customer_reviews.author: Jay

product_meta.title: Master & Dynamic MH40 Over Ear Headphone - Brown/Silver MH40S2
product_meta.description:
Colour Name:Brown/Silver

Master & Dynamic MH40

The MH40 is Master & Dynamic's ideal-selling, award winning wired headphone. Master & Dynamic has married design with the higher technical specs to provide a sound signature that delights audiophiles around the world.

Driver size - 45 mm
Driver diaphragm - engineered polymer
Driver motor - neodymium
Weight - 360 g
Impedance - 32 ohms
Body - aluminium
Frequency - 5-25000 Hz
Sensitivity - average 106 db SPL@ 1 m W
THD (distortion) - Less than 0.1 percent at 1 m W for main audio range


Elegant iconic design in addition to high quality sound

Master & Dynamic's headphones create the ideal balance of aesthetics, strength, comfort and utility.

Over-ear styling with soft lambskin, memory foam ear pads. Ear pads are magnetically connected and replaceable which ensure decades of use.

Premium leatherdesign includes heavy grain premium cowhide on headband exterior surface and ear cup insets and soft lambskin on headband interior and ear pads.

Stainless steel details

Stainless steel design components in all high strain areas

Forged aluminium bodyfor durability

Heavy-duty woven cablesoxygen free copper to ensure pure sound and reduced noise. Tangle free.



BOX CONTAINS


 * Headphone
 * 3.5/6.3 mm gold-plated adapter
 * 1.25 m cable with Remote and mic (iPod, iPad, and iPhone)
 * 2.00 m standard cable
 * Canvas headphone case
 * Leather cable box
feature_bullets: Rich sound tuned for a rich, warm sound, the MH40 offers a natural, detailed, live sound signature that captures the exceptional detail of well-recorded music; Master & Dynamic tuning is designed to complement a diverse range of musical genres
Industry leader: Positively reviewed and highly praised by industry leaders for both sound and build quality

Technically Master & Dynamic has a deep passion for designing technically sophisticated headphones that look as elegant as they sound; the MH40 features the most high technology including the highest performance 45 mm Neodymium drivers; other features include dual audio ports, mute button, removable ear pads, inline mic. and fold flat design

Premium Materials - elegantly designed and built for decades of use using the highest quality luxury materials including premium leather, stainless steel, and aluminum - creating an iconic, durable and timeless look. Key components, including our lambskin ear pads and woven cables, are designed to be replaceable to ensure longevity

Warranty - Master & Dynamic offers a limited 2 years warranty against defect; use the serial code to register the product to ensure priority customer service; please make sure headphones are purchased from an authorised reseller to guarantee coverage
